newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee slumps on strong dlr demand.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee slumps on strong dlr demand.

text.p: Low money rates and commercial demand for the greenback pushed down the Sri Lanka rupee to below 58 to the dollar, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 58.15 to the dollar after opening at 57.84. "Import covering and banks using low call rates to build dollar positions pushed down the rupee," said a foreign bank dealer.

The Central Bank said on Monday it was cutting the reserve requirement by two percent to boost market liqudity. Overnight call money rates closed at 9.5 percent, with the market well offered, dealers said.
"The morning's import bill was just the signal which banks, that were shy to build positions depsite falling rates, was waiting for," said a local bank dealer.
